question_text: A 58-year-old man is evaluated for macrocytic anemia. He also has leukopenia and thrombocytopenia.Peripheral blood smear is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is myelodysplastic syndrome (Option C). The peripheral blood smear from this patient with myelodysplastic syndrome shows a dysplastic neutrophil (white arrow) with hypogranular cytoplasm and a dysplastic nucleus. A nucleated erythrocyte is also seen in this field (black arrow). The myelodysplastic syndromes are a group of clonal stem cell disorders with ineffective hematopoiesis leading to dysplastic, hypercellular bone marrow and peripheral blood cytopenias.

figures.title: Stem Peripheral Blood Smear Showing Dysplastic Neutrophil and Nucleated Erythrocyte
Critique Peripheral Blood Smear Showing Dysplastic Neutrophil and Nucleated Erythrocyte
